messages.title: Fighting against Hard Brexit
messages.content: Liberal Democrats are the only party that has always fought for Britain's membership of the European Union and we are fighting for you to have your say on the final Brexit deal.

messages.title: Standing up for the NHS
messages.content: Only the Liberal Democrats would give the NHS the funds it needs by raising a penny on income tax to provide an additional £6 billion for health and care services.

messages.title: Opposing school cuts
messages.content: Local schools are under threat from a Conservative Party that has stopped listening to local people in North West Norfolk. Schools in Norfolk are set to lose over £40 million from their budgets.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats oppose a hard Brexit and are campaigning to give citizens a say on the final deal with the EU.
The party plans to invest an additional £6 billion in health and care services by raising income tax.
The Liberal Democrats oppose the Conservative Party's education budget cuts that are projected to affect schools in Norfolk negatively.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A good result for the Lib Dems in North West Norfolk can challenge a damaging 'hard' Brexit that will hit jobs, the economy and local services.

issues.brexitEurope: Liberal Democrats are fighting to give citizens a say on the final Brexit deal.
issues.economy: A 'hard' Brexit will hit jobs and the economy.
issues.education: Schools in Norfolk are set to lose over £40 million from their budgets.
issues.health: Liberal Democrats plan to invest an additional £6 billion in health and care services.
